description: Data leakage detection refers to the identification of situations where information from outside the training dataset is used to create the model, leading to overly optimistic performance estimates. This problem is crucial in machine learning as it can significantly impact the reliability of model predictions.
you_have_this_if: You notice discrepancies between training and validation performance.
Your model performs significantly better on training data than on unseen data.
You have limited annotated datasets for training models.
You are concerned about the integrity of your machine learning pipeline.
You want to ensure that your model generalizes well to new data.

approaches.technique: Transfer Learning, Active Learning, Low-shot Prompting
approaches.best_for: when you need to automate the detection of data leakage in ML code and have limited annotated datasets.
approaches.key_tradeoff: This approach can improve model quality but may require careful tuning and validation.

decision_matrix.technique: Transfer Learning, Active Learning, Low-shot Prompting
decision_matrix.best_when: You have limited data and need to leverage existing models to detect leakage effectively.

start_here: The recommended first approach is to use Transfer Learning, Active Learning, and Low-shot Prompting, as it allows you to utilize existing knowledge while addressing the challenges of limited annotated datasets.
